info.title: Inbox API
info.description:
The Inbox API gives you full access to manage the following entities in your team:
- **Threads**: DM conversations on X
- **Account links**: X accounts connected to your team
- **Members**: users who can access the team
- **Prospects**: external profiles on X
- **Tags**: labels for prospects
- **Statuses**: pipeline statuses for prospects

As of now, access to the following is not available:
- **Lists**: Saved collections of leads
- **Campaigns**: Automated DM sequences

## A quick note on IDs
Inbox stores two types of IDs for objects that relate to X:
- `id` ‚Äî The Inbox ID, which is the ID of the Inbox object
- `platformId` ‚Äî The original X 'platform' ID, which is the ID of the X user, conversation, etc.

Throughout the API, you'll see instances where multiple IDs are present. `platformId` is always the original X ID.

## Helpful X URLs

You can use platform IDs to construct direct links to X:

- **User profile**: `https://x.com/i/user/{platformId}` ‚Äî This is the most reliable way to link to a user since it uses their immutable ID rather than their username, which can change.
- **User by username**: `https://x.com/{username}` ‚Äî Note that usernames can change, so this link may break if the user updates their handle.
- **Tweet/Post**: `https://x.com/anyusername/status/{tweetId}` ‚Äî The username in the URL is ignored by X; only the tweet ID matters. You can use any string in place of the username and the link will still work.
- **DM conversation**: `https://x.com/i/chat/{conversationPlatformId}` ‚Äî The conversation ID is formatted as `{smallerUserId}:{largerUserId}`, where the two participant user IDs are sorted numerically (smaller ID first).

## Encoding objects and arrays in query params

Inbox's API uses bracket notation to denote objects and arrays.

### Objects
For an endpoint that accepts a `cursor` parameter for instance, with the cursor object being
```json
{
  id: "l44e15irdq4db30i77cgphhx",
  timestamp: "2025-11-10T18:03:16.000Z"
}
```

The URL search params would be encoded as:
```txt
?cursor[id]=l44e15irdq4db30i77cgphhx&cursor[timestamp]=2025-11-10T18:03:16.000Z
```

### Arrays
For an endpoint that accepts an `ids` parameter for instance, with the value being
```json
["1", "2", "3"]
```

there are three options:
1. Repeat the parameter for each value:
```txt
?ids=1&ids=2&ids=3
```
2. Append `[]` to explicitly denote an array (useful if there's only one value):
```txt
?ids[]=1&ids[]=2&ids[]=3
```
3. Append `[number]` to denote the array index. This option is the most flexible and allows for reordering and skipping values:
```txt
?ids[0]=1&ids[1]=2&ids[2]=3
```
info.summary: The Inbox API gives you full access to manage the following entities in your team.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description: Teams are shared workspace for members to view and manage account links, tags, statuses, campaigns, conversations, and more.

tags.name: Threads
tags.description: Threads represent conversations between an account linked to your team and a prospect on Twitter.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Messages are the individual messages sent in a thread.

tags.name: Account Links
tags.description: Account links represent X accounts connected to your team.

tags.name: Members
tags.description: Members are Inbox users who can access the team.

tags.name: Prospects
tags.description: Prospects represent external profiles on X.

tags.name: Statuses
tags.description: Statuses are used to track the deal stage or any fixed state for a prospect.

tags.name: Colors
tags.description: Get predefined color options that can be used when creating or updating tags and statuses.

platform.description: The social platform where this prospect's profile exists.

platformId.description: The platform's native user ID. For Twitter, this is the numeric user ID. This is the primary identifier for cross-platform operations.

externalId.description: Unique identifier for this prospect in the Inbox system. Null if the prospect hasn't been imported yet.

documentId.description: Search index identifier for fast lookups. Null if the prospect isn't indexed yet.

displayName.description: The user's display name as shown on their profile. For businesses, typically the company name.

username.description: The unique handle/username on the platform, without the @ symbol. Always lowercase for Twitter.

handle.description: The username with @ symbol prefix, ready for display in UI. Computed from username.

image.description: Profile picture URL as provided by platform. May contain size suffixes or be lower quality. Prefer imageNormalized for display.

imageNormalized.description: Profile picture URL normalized to highest quality available. Size suffixes removed. Prefer this over image for display.

examples: Social Selling CRM Close deals faster, stay organized, and never miss an opportunity. Starting with X

location.description: Freeform location string as entered by user. Not normalized or geocoded.

profileUrl.description: Direct link to view this profile on the platform.

websiteUrl.description: External website URL the user provided in their profile, if any.

websiteDomain.description: Domain extracted from websiteUrl for quick filtering and grouping.

verified.description: Verification badge status: none (no badge), verified (blue checkmark), business (gold badge), or government (gray badge).

profileType.description: Account type classification: personal (individual), business (organization), or government (official agency).

isProtected.description: Whether the account is private/protected. For Twitter: protected tweets enabled. Private accounts require approval to follow.

followerCount.description: Number of users following this account.

followingCount.description: Number of users this account follows.

postCount.description: Total content posted by this account. For Twitter: tweet count. For Instagram: post count.

engagementCount.description: Platform-specific engagement metric. For Twitter: likes/favorites given by user. May be null if platform doesn't provide this.

listedCount.description: How many Twitter lists this profile appears on. Useful metric for influence. Null for non-Twitter platforms.

platformCreatedAt.description: When the account was created on the platform. Null if platform doesn't provide this data.

firstSeenAt.description: When this prospect was first added to Inbox. Useful for tracking relationship timeline.

lastUpdatedAt.description: Most recent update timestamp for any data about this prospect.

lastEnrichedAt.description: When fresh data was last fetched from the platform API. Use this to determine if data needs refresh.

lastActiveAt.description: Last time the profile was active on the platform (posted, liked, or engaged). Platform-dependent availability.

source.description: Data source: cached (stored), indexed (searchable), live (real-time from platform), or merged (combined sources).

isFresh.description: Indicates if data was updated within the last 7 days. Fresh data is current and reliable.

isStale.description: Indicates if data hasn't been updated in over 30 days. Stale data may need refreshing for accuracy.

confidence.description: Confidence score for data accuracy (0-1). Higher values indicate more recent and reliable data. 1.0 = real-time, 0.8+ = recent, below 0.5 = potentially outdated.

isVerifiedBlue.description: Standard Twitter blue checkmark verification badge.

isVerifiedGold.description: Gold verification badge indicating a business/brand account on Twitter.

isVerifiedGray.description: Gray verification badge indicating a government/official account on Twitter.

professionalCategory.description: Professional category ID if the account has set one. Maps to categories like Technology, Media, Education, etc.

url.description: Shortened t.co URL as it appears in the tweet text.

expandedUrl.description: Full expanded URL that the t.co link redirects to.

displayUrl.description: Human-readable display text for the URL (typically domain + path).

indices.description: Start and end character indices where this URL appears in the bio text.

urlEntities.description: Parsed URL entities from the bio text with expanded and display URLs.

bannerUrl.description: Profile banner/header image URL (typically 1500x500px). Null if no banner is set.

tweetsCount.description: Total number of tweets posted by this account (all-time count).

favoritesCount.description: Total number of likes/favorites this user has given to other tweets.

rawData.description: Full Twitter API user object for backward compatibility and advanced use cases. Null if not available from the data source.

platform.description: The platform this thread belongs to.

platformId.description: The platform ID of the conversation.

done.description: Whether the thread has been archived or not.

assigneeId.description: The ID of the member assigned to the thread.

lastMessageTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the last message in the thread.

computedSortTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the last message in the thread or the creation date if no messages have been sent.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the thread was created in Inbox.

status.description: Idle threads are hidden from the main inbox, i.e. when previewing a profile using 'Quick peek'

variant.description: Will be set to "unencrypted" by default for new conversations until both parties have exchanged messages. Once each party has sent at least one message, the conversation transitions to "xChat" (encrypted).

accountLinkId.description: The ID of the account link associated with this thread.

isSyncing.description: Whether the thread is currently syncing data from Twitter to load all messages.

isRequest.description: Whether this conversation is a message request.

typingIndicatorsEnabled.description: Whether typing indicators are enabled for this thread. If set to null, will use the team default setting.

id.description: The ID of the last message in the thread. This is the message that will be displayed in the thread preview.

content.description: The content of the last message in the thread.
examples: Hey, I'm reaching out from Acme Agency...

authorId.description: Points to either the accountLinkId or the externalId of the thread. May be a cuid2 or a legacy external ID.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the last message was created in Inbox.

userId.description: The ID of the Inbox user who sent the last message in the thread. Note that this is not a member ID.

campaignId.description: The ID of the campaign that sent the last message in the thread. This is only set if the last message was sent by a campaign.

tags.description: The tag IDs attached to this prospect.

statusId.description: The status ID of the prospect.

examples: This prospect is a potential customer.

platform.description: The platform the message was sent from.

id.description: The Inbox ID of the message.

userId.description: The Inbox user who sent this message if applicable.

examples: Hey, I'm reaching out from Acme Agency...

campaignId.description: The Inbox campaign ID that sent this message if applicable.

authorId.description: Will either be the `accountLinkId` or the `externalId` of the thread. May be a cuid2 or a legacy external ID.

origin.description: The origin of the message. 'internal' means send from a user on Inbox, 'external' means synced from Twitter, 'api' means sent via the API.

replyData.description: The reply data of the message if applicable.

forwardData.description: The forward data of the message if applicable.

entities.description: Normalized URL entities, mentions, hashtags, tweet shares.

isEncrypted.description: Whether the message is end-to-end encrypted.

isEdited.description: Whether the message has been edited.

deletedAt.description: When the message was soft-deleted in Inbox.

platformDeletedAt.description: When the message was deleted on the platform.

id.description: The Inbox ID of the account link.

platformId.description: The platform ID of the account link.

status.description: X may periodically sign out your account, in which case it will be marked as `offline`. An account can get paused if the team is scheduled for deletion or in other circumstances, and is a far less common state that has nothing to do with the X API.

syncedAt.description: When this account was completely synced for the first time.

image.description: The URL of the team's avatar image.

createdAt.description: The date and time the team was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the team was last updated.

currency.description: The currency of the team. Used for valuation of prospects.

allowSupportAccess.description: Whether support access is allowed for the team.

id.description: The ID of the team member.

userId.description: The user ID of the member. Users can be part of multiple teams.

createdAt.description: The date and time this member was added to the team.

updatedAt.description: The date and time this member was last updated.

name.description: The display name of the status. Typically represents a stage in your sales pipeline.

color.description: Hex color code for the status (e.g., #10b981 for green). Null if no color is set.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when this status was created.

name.description: The display name of the tag.

color.description: Hex color code for the tag or predefined color (available via GET /colors).

Inbox view to filter threads. 'default' shows active threads, 'no-reply' shows threads awaiting response, 'requests' shows message requests, 'archived' shows archived threads.

selectedIds.description: Array of tag IDs to filter by.

noTags.description: When true, only show threads with no tags assigned. When false, this filter is ignored.

tags.description: Filter threads by tags. Use selectedIds to filter by specific tags, or set noTags to true to show only untagged threads.

selectedIds.description: Array of status IDs to filter by.

noStatus.description: When true, only show threads with no status assigned. When false, this filter is ignored.

statuses.description: Filter threads by status. Use selectedIds to filter by specific statuses, or set noStatus to true to show only threads without a status.

selectedIds.description: Array of member IDs to filter by.

noAssignee.description: When true, only show unassigned threads. When false, this filter is ignored.

assignees.description: Filter threads by assignee. Use selectedIds to filter by specific team members, or set noAssignee to true to show only unassigned threads.

selectedIds.description: Array of campaign IDs to filter by.

noCampaign.description: When true, only show threads not associated with any campaign. When false, this filter is ignored.

campaigns.description: Filter threads by campaign. Use selectedIds to filter by specific campaigns, or set noCampaign to true to show only non-campaign threads.

sortOrder.description: Sort order for threads. 'desc' shows most recent first (default), 'asc' shows oldest first.

schema.description: Advanced filtering options for threads. Pass null or omit to disable all filters.
Maximum number of threads to return per page. Defaults to 20, maximum 100.
